citing_paper_authors: Tao, Tao | Su-Youn, Yoon | Andrew, Fister | Richard W., Sproat | ChengXiang, Zhai
raw_text: In our work, we adopt the method proposed in (Tao and Zhai, 2005) and apply it to the problem of transliteration; note that (Tao and Zhai, 2005) compares several different metrics for time correlation, as we also note below? and see (Sproat et al., 2006)
clean_text: In our work, we adopt the method proposed in (Tao and Zhai, 2005) and apply it to the problem of transliteration; note that (Tao and Zhai, 2005) compares several different metrics for time correlation, as we also note below and see (Sproat et al., 2006).

raw_text: However, several techniques for mining name transliterations from monolingual and comparable corpora have been studied (Pasternack and Roth, 2009), (Goldwasser and Roth, 2008), (Klementiev and Roth, 2006), (Sproat et al, 2006), (Udupa et al,2009b)
clean_text: However, several techniques for mining name transliterations from monolingual and comparable corpora have been studied (Pasternack and Roth, 2009), (Goldwasser and Roth, 2008), (Klementiev and Roth, 2006), (Sproat et al, 2006), (Udupa et al,2009b).

citing_paper_authors: Jin-Shea, Kuo | Haizhou, Li | Chih-Lung, Lin
raw_text: These include studying the query logs (Brill et al, 2001), unrelated corpora (Rapp, 1999), and comparable corpora (Sproat et al 2006)
clean_text: These include studying the query logs (Brill et al, 2001), unrelated corpora (Rapp, 1999), and comparable corpora (Sproat et al 2006).

citing_paper_authors: Jin-Shea, Kuo | Haizhou, Li | Chih-Lung, Lin
raw_text: An initial PSM is bootstrapped using limited prior knowledge such as a small amount of transliterations, which may be obtained by exploiting co occurrence information (Sproat et al, 2006)
clean_text: An initial PSM is bootstrapped using limited prior knowledge such as a small amount of transliterations, which may be obtained by exploiting co-occurrence information (Sproat et al, 2006).

raw_text: In transliteration extraction, mining translations or transliterations from the ever-growing multilingual Web has become an active research topic, for example, by exploring query logs (Brill et al., 2001) and parallel (Nie et al, 1999) or comparable corpora (Sproat et al, 2006)
clean_text: In transliteration extraction, mining translations or transliterations from the ever-growing multilingual Web has become an active research topic, for example, by exploring query logs (Brill et al., 2001) and parallel (Nie et al, 1999) or comparable corpora (Sproat et al, 2006).

citing_paper_authors: Inderjeet, Mani | Alexander S., Yeh | Sherri L., Condon
raw_text: (Sproat et al 2006) have compared names from comparable and contemporaneous English and Chinese texts ,scoring matches by training a learning algorithm to compare the phonemic representations of the names in the pair, in addition to taking into account the frequency distribution of the pair over time
clean_text: (Sproat et al 2006) have compared names from comparable and contemporaneous English and Chinese texts, scoring matches by training a learning algorithm to compare the phonemic representations of the names in the pair, in addition to taking into account the frequency distribution of the pair over time.

citing_paper_authors: Ming-Wei, Chang | Dan, Goldwasser | Dan, Roth | Yuancheng, Tu
raw_text: For example, (Sproat et al, 2006) presents a supervised system that achieves a MRR score of 0.89, when evaluated over a dataset consisting of 400 English NE and 627 Chinese words
clean_text: For example, (Sproat et al, 2006) presents a supervised system that achieves a MRR score of 0.89, when evaluated over a dataset consisting of 400 English NE and 627 Chinese words.

raw_text: Sproat et al2006) report an oracle accuracy of 85%, but it depends on the source of the candidate transliterations
